clinical_study.brief_title: Beetroot Juice Supplementation in Basketball Players
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Beetroot Juice Supplementation in Neuromuscular Performance and Match Activity in Young Basketball Players

brief_summary.textblock: Whereas beetroot juice (BJ) supplementation is shown to increase physical performance in endurance activities, its benefits in team sports has been barely studied. In this randomized placebo-controlled study, we investigated the effects of BJ acute supplementation in improving neuromuscular performance and physical match activity in basketball.

detailed_description.textblock: Whereas beetroot juice (BJ) supplementation is shown to increase physical performance in endurance activities, its benefits in team sports has been barely studied. In this randomized placebo-controlled study, we investigated the effects of BJ acute supplementation in improving neuromuscular performance and physical match activity in basketball.Testing sessions will comprised a neuromuscular test battery consisting of a countermovement jump (CMJ), isometric handgrip strength, 10-m/20-m sprint and agility T-test, followed by a 40-minute simulated basketball match. Physical match activity (distances, speeds, accelerations and decelerations) will be monitored in real time using an inertial tracking system

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Using a wireless inertial movement unit system

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in maximal isometric handgrip strength (kg)

secondary_outcome.description: Maximal jump height using a contact platform
Time to complete 10-m and 20-m sprints using photocell timing gates
Time to complete the modified T-test using photocell timing gates

intervention.description: One serving 140 mL of BJ (12.8 mmol of NO3−; Beet-It-Pro Elite Shot, James White Drinks Ltd., Ipswich, UK) after an overnight fast and 3 h before initiating the testing session.
One serving placebo drink (0.08 mmol of NO3−; Salud Viva, Nano Salud 32 S.L) after an overnight fast and 3 h before initiating the testing session.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- active basketball player
- more than 5 years of basketball training experience
Exclusion Criteria:
- concurrently participating in other studies
- contraindications to BJ diet
- physical limitations, health problems, or musculoskeletal injuries
